abstract: Chinese banks have begun restricting new loans, responding to a push by regulators to contain credit after a surge in lending in the first half of this month, sources told Bloomberg News.
snippet: Chinese banks have begun restricting new loans, responding to a push by regulators to contain credit after a surge in lending in the first half of this month, sources told Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: Chinese banks have begun restricting new loans, responding to a push by regulators to contain credit after a surge in lending in the first half of this month, sources told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Chinese Banks Said to Rein in Loans
